name: Business & Finance
description: Business and financial terminology commonly used in corporate environments

definitions.definition: Return on Investment - A measure of the profitability of an investment
The ratio of net profit to the cost of investment, usually expressed as a percentage
Key Performance Indicator - A measurable value that demonstrates how effectively a company is achieving key business objectives
Profit and Loss statement - A financial statement that summarizes revenues, costs, and expenses
Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization - A measure of a company's overall financial performance
Business to Business - Commerce transactions between businesses
Business to Consumer - Commerce transactions between a business and individual consumers
Service Level Agreement - A contract that defines the level of service expected from a vendor
Annual Recurring Revenue - The value of recurring revenue normalized to a one-year period
Monthly Recurring Revenue - The predictable revenue that a business can expect every month
Customer Acquisition Cost - The cost of acquiring a new customer
Lifetime Value - The total revenue expected from a customer over their entire relationship with a company
The percentage of customers who stop using a product or service during a given time period
Minimum Viable Product - A product with just enough features to satisfy early customers
Initial Public Offering - The first time a company offers shares to the public
Venture Capital - Financing provided to startups and small businesses with growth potential
Private Equity - Investment in companies not publicly traded on a stock exchange
Price to Earnings ratio - A valuation metric comparing share price to earnings per share
Year over Year - Comparing metrics from one year to the same period in the previous year
Quarter over Quarter - Comparing metrics from one quarter to the previous quarter
Compound Annual Growth Rate - The mean annual growth rate over a specified period
Net Promoter Score - A metric for assessing customer loyalty and satisfaction
